Package org.firmata

Class Firmata

java.lang.Object
org.firmata.Firmata
public class Firmata extends Object
Internal class used by the Arduino class to parse the Firmata protocol.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    Firmata.Writer
    An interface that the Firmata class uses to write output to the Arduino board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Firmata

      public Firmata​(Firmata.Writer writer)
      Create a proxy to an Arduino board running the Firmata 2 firmware.
      Parameters:
      writer - an instance of the Firmata.Writer interface

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Enable all ports

    • digitalRead

      public int digitalRead​(int pin)
      Returns the last known value read from the digital pin: HIGH or LOW.
      Parameters:
      pin - the digital pin whose value should be returned (from 2 to 13, since pins 0 and 1 are used for serial communication)
      Returns:
      state of selected pin

    • analogRead

      public int analogRead​(int pin)
      Returns the last known value read from the analog pin: 0 (0 volts) to 1023 (5 volts).
      Parameters:
      pin - the analog pin whose value should be returned (from 0 to 5)
      Returns:
      integer value representing ADC (0-1023)

    • pinMode

      public void pinMode​(int pin, int mode)
      Set a digital pin to input or output mode.
      Parameters:
      pin - the pin whose mode to set (from 2 to 13)
      mode - either Arduino.INPUT or Arduino.OUTPUT

    • digitalWrite

      public void digitalWrite​(int pin, int value)
      Write to a digital pin (the pin must have been put into output mode with pinMode()).
      Parameters:
      pin - the pin to write to (from 2 to 13)
      value - the value to write: Arduino.LOW (0 volts) or Arduino.HIGH (5 volts)

    • analogWrite

      public void analogWrite​(int pin, int value)
      Write an analog value (PWM-wave) to a digital pin.
      Parameters:
      pin - the pin to write to (must be 9, 10, or 11, as those are they only ones which support hardware pwm)
      value - the value: 0 being the lowest (always off), and 255 the highest (always on)

    • servoWrite

      public void servoWrite​(int pin, int value)
      Write a value to a servo pin.
      Parameters:
      pin - the pin the servo is attached to
      value - the value: 0 being the lowest angle, and 180 the highest angle

    • mcp4725config

      public void mcp4725config()
      I2C config

    • mcp4725

      public void mcp4725​(int address, int value)
      I2C write value to an mcp4725 DAC
      Parameters:
      address - i2c address of device
      value - 12 bit voltage value as integer (0-4096)

    • freqConfig

      public void freqConfig​(int pin, int mode, int period)
      Measure frequency events on a pin
      Parameters:
      pin - the pin used for frequency measurement
      mode - the type of interrupt used to measure frequency (3->RISING, 4->FALLING, 5->CHANGE)
      period - the interval used for measuremnt (period of reporting data)

    • freqRead

      public float freqRead()
      Returns the last known value of frequency measured on pin 2
      Returns:
      frequency float

    • periodRead

      public float periodRead()
      read a period from the frequency counter
      Returns:
      period as float

    • stepsRead

      public int stepsRead()
      read the current steps from the sysex message after a report request
      Returns:
      current steps

    • moveComplete

      public int moveComplete()
      gets the devicenumber for a stepper who has completed its steps
      Returns:
      moveDeviceNum

    • freqDisable

      public void freqDisable​(int pin)
      Configure frequency measurement on an arduino pin with interrupt
      Parameters:
      pin - pin used for interrupt based frequency measurements

    • asConfig

      public void asConfig​(int deviceNum, int stepPin, int dirPin)
      Configure a stepper motor using
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the number identifying the specific stepper motor 0-9
      stepPin - pin connected to stepper motor step pin
      dirPin - pin connected to stepper motor direction pin

    • asZero

      public void asZero​(int deviceNum)
      Set the zero position on a stepper motor
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the number identifying the specific stepper motor 0-9

    • asStep

      public void asStep​(int deviceNum, int steps)
      Drive a stepper motor with a given number of steps
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the number identifying the specific stepper motor 0-9
      steps - the number of steps to drive stepper motor (signed 32bit integer)

    • asTo

      public void asTo​(int deviceNum, int moveto)
      Drive a stepper motor to a step location (must have been zeroed during homing to be accurate)
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the number identifying the specific stepper motor 0-9
      moveto - the desired step location (signed 32bit integer)

    • asStop

      public void asStop​(int deviceNum)
      Stop a stepper motor
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the specific stepper motor to stop

    • asReport

      public void asReport​(int deviceNum)
      Report the position of a stepper motor
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the stepper motor which we want a report

    • asSetSpeed

      public void asSetSpeed​(int deviceNum, float speed)
      Set the maximum speed of a stepper motor in steps/second
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the stepper motor which we want to set speed
      speed - the maximum speed in steps/second

    • asSetAccel

      public void asSetAccel​(int deviceNum, float accel)
      Set the acceleration/deceleration of a stepper motor in steps/second^2
      Parameters:
      deviceNum - the stepper motor which we want a report
      accel - the acceleration in steps/second^2

    • asMultiConfig

      public void asMultiConfig​(int groupNum, int deviceNum1, int deviceNum2)
      Setup a group of steppers using Multistepper
      Parameters:
      groupNum - the group number you would like to setup
      deviceNum1 - the first stepper number which we want to add to group
      deviceNum2 - the second stepper number which we want to add to group

    • asMultiTo

      public void asMultiTo​(int groupNum, int moveto)
      Drive a Multistepper group to a step location (must have been zeroed during homing to be accurate)
      Parameters:
      groupNum - the number identifying the specific Multistepper group we want to move
      moveto - the desired step location (signed 32bit integer)

    • asMultiStop

      public void asMultiStop​(int groupNum)
      Stop a Multistepper group
      Parameters:
      groupNum - the number identifying the specific Multistepper group we want to move

    • encode32bit

      public static int[] encode32bit​(int val)
      Encode a signed 32 bit integer to use in other functions
      Parameters:
      val - the number (signed 32 bit integer)
      Returns:
      integer array of the encoded message

    • decode32bit

      public static int decode32bit​(int arg0, int arg1, int arg2, int arg3, int arg4)
      Decode a signed 32 bit integer to use in other functions
      Parameters:
      arg0 - bits (0-6)
      arg1 - bits (7-13)
      arg2 - bits (14-20)
      arg3 - bits (21-27)
      arg4 - bits (28-31, ignore 32-34)
      Returns:
      32 bit decoded value

    • freqDecode

      public static int freqDecode​(int arg0, int arg1, int arg2, int arg3, int arg4)
      Decode an unsigned 32 bit integer to use in other functions
      Parameters:
      arg0 - bits (0-6)
      arg1 - bits (7-13)
      arg2 - bits (14-20)
      arg3 - bits (21-27)
      arg4 - bits (28-31, ignore 32-34)
      Returns:
      32 bit decoded value

    • encodeCustomFloat

      public static int encodeCustomFloat​(float decimal)
      Encode a custom float to communicate with Accelstepper
      Parameters:
      decimal - the float we would like to encode as a custom float
      Returns:
      the encoded array

    • decodeCustomFloat

      public static float decodeCustomFloat​(int encoded)
      Decode a custom float to communicate with Accelstepper
      Parameters:
      encoded - the float we would like to decode from a custom float
      Returns:
      decoded float

    • processInput

      public void processInput​(int inputData)
      Process incoming messages from Sysex
      Parameters:
      inputData - is the message to decode
